newsitem.title: GREECE: Albanian gunmen holding border post kill traveller.
newsitem.headline: Albanian gunmen holding border post kill traveller.

text.p: Masked gunmen controlling an abandoned Albanian customs post on the border with Greece shot dead an Albanian man for refusing to hand over his money, the semi-official Athens News Agency (ANA) reported.
"The customs post at Kakavia was now controlled by masked and armed Albanians who extort money from anyone wishing to cross," ANA quoted eyewitnesses as saying.
The Albanian, Musati Figiri, 31, refused to pay and was shot and seriously injured. He died later at the hospital of the northern Greek city of Ioannina, ANA said.
Albanian customs police and soldiers abandoned the border post over the weekend, after an anti-government armed uprising in the south, sparked by the collapse of pyramid savings schemes.

Albanian President Sali Berisha, pressured by the growing unrest, has agreed to form a new multi-party government and hold early elections but insurgents have snubbed his offer of amnesty and vowed to hold on to weapons looted from army arsenals.
Looters have been roaming the south, and on Tuesday an eight-storey hotel in the rebel-held Albanian coastal town of Sarande was ransacked and set ablaze, witnesses said.
They said the looters carried out furniture, silverware, toilet seats, doors and lamps before setting fire to the hotel in central Sarande.
A council set up by the town rebels said looters would be punished but people drove up to the hotel throughout the day, loading up Cars and trucks before driving off.
